response.original_title: Dylan Thomas - A War Films Anthology
response.overview: Eight of the finest wartime works by the world-renowned poet Dylan Thomas who made a little-known but valuable contribution to Britainâ€™s war effort scripting powerful propaganda films for the Ministry of Information. This anthology collects together eight of his finest wartime works:  "THESE ARE THE MEN" (1943) - a blistering attack on the Nazis:  "BALLOON SITE 568" (1942) - the women who worked as barrage balloon operators  "WALES, GREEN MOUNTAIN, BLACK MOUNTAIN" (1942) - a tribute to Wales at war;  "NEW TOWNS FOR OLD" (1942) - urban regeneration in the fictional town of Smokesdale;  "THE BATTLE FOR FREEDOM" (1942) - the contribution made by the Empire towards the British war effort;  "CEMA" (1942) - the Council for the Encouragement of Music and the Arts;  "A CITY REBORN" (1945) - a salute to the city Coventry;  "A SOLDIER COMES HOME" (1945) - a soldier on leave with his family in London.
response.title: Dylan Thomas - A War Films Anthology
